summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets are for Tiers G through M and document the required irregular observation rounds for inmates in locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation. The sheets are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Daily Inmate Observation Rounds
events.description: Standard 30-minute observation checks were conducted throughout the day and night for inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York. The checks are required to be conducted on an irregular schedule, at least twice per hour, for inmates in continuous locked-down status.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU)
keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing inmate observation protocols for August 10, 2019.
It covers Tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M within the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The protocol requires staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with checks no more than 40 minutes apart.
The log sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document itself does not name any specific inmates or staff members; it is a procedural form.
